meanings.definition: A typical amount, rate, or level of something
meanings.sent1: The average amount of rainfall in this region is 20 inches per year.
meanings.sent2: She scored an average of 85% on her math tests this semester.
meanings.sent3: It's not exciting, but eating oatmeal for breakfast every day is pretty average.
meanings.sent4: His performance in the game was below average compared to his usual skill level.
meanings.sent5: The average height of the students in the class was around 5 feet.

meanings.definition: A number expressing the central or typical value in a set of data
meanings.sent2: In statistics, the mean is another term for average.
meanings.sent3: The average of the ages of the siblings was used to determine who would go first.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity make her the average of a good friend.
meanings.sent5: The average of the test scores showed a steady improvement over the semester.

meanings.definition: To calculate the average of a set of numbers
meanings.sent1: Let's average the scores of the students to see how they performed.
meanings.sent2: She decided to average the temperatures recorded over the week.
meanings.sent3: I can average the prices of the items to see which one is the best deal.
meanings.sent4: He will average the distances traveled to estimate the total distance covered.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to average their quiz scores for the semester.
